message.content:
We must “close‐out” the operations for Interest Receivables over the reporting period. In the cash‐flow statement the change in a current “asset” is computed as the ending balance minus the beginning balance. (An increase in an asset is shown as a decrease in cash.) In our example no beginning balance is given so we assume zero at start. (In other words, the entire ending balance represents an increase.) 

The procedure is as follows:

1. From the list of transactions, note every record with type “Interest Receivables” (these represent the periodic accruals on interest income that have not been collected yet).  
2. Sum the amounts for all such records. (Recall that in the cash‐flow statement, even though these “assets” appear as positive numbers, an increase in an asset “uses” cash and is shown as a negative number.)

For the given problem the Interest Receivable entries are (with their amounts listed):

 • Interest20240101001:    1201.5  
 • Interest20240102002:    1078.13164875  
 • Interest20240103003:    935.73164875  
 • Interest20240104004:    935.73164875  
 • Interest20240105005:    935.73164875  
 • Interest20240106006:    935.73164875  
 • Interest20240107007:    935.73164875  
 • Interest20240108008:    935.73164875  
 • Interest20240109009:    846.73164875  
 • Interest20240110010:    846.73164875  
 • Interest20240111011:    846.73164875  
 • Interest20240112012:    846.73164875  
 • Interest20240113013:    704.33164875  
 • Interest20240114014:    704.33164875  
 • Interest20240115015:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240116016:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240117017:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240118018:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240119019:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240120020:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240121021:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240122022:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240123023:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240124024:    615.33164875  
 • Interest20240125025:    570.83164875  
 • Interest20240126026:    570.83164875  
 • Interest20240127027:    570.83164875  
 • Interest20240128028:    570.83164875  
 • Interest20240129029:    437.33164875  
 • Interest20240130030:    437.33164875  
 • Interest20240131031:    437.33164875  
 • Interest20240201032:    229.08465788  
 • Interest20240202033:    229.08465788  
 • Interest20240203034:    229.08465788  
 • Interest20240204035:    229.08465788  
 • Interest20240205036:    229.08465788  

When you add all of these (we grouped them for easier accounting) the total comes to approximately 23,583.67. (A quick grouping–for example, six entries of ~935.73 gives about 5614.39; four entries of ~846.73 gives about 3386.93; and so on–leads to a grand total in the neighborhood of 23,583.67.)

Since (assuming a zero beginning balance) the ending balance is 23,583.67, it is an increase in the asset account. In the operating section of the cash flow statement an increase in an asset is shown with a negative sign. 

Thus the (Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable item is –23,583.67.

The answer is therefore:

{
  "solution": {
    "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-23583.67"
  }
}
